summary: Email chain from August 12, 2019, between FBI and NYC Medical Examiner's Office regarding coordination of evidence and interviews related to Jeffrey Epstein's death. The FBI is sending evidence to the medical examiner and coordinating interviews with those who discovered the body.

persons.name: Rafael Vasquez
persons.context: Recipient of FBI email regarding coordination of interviews related to Epstein's death.

connections.description: Both are associated with the NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) and involved in the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Evidence transfer and interview coordination
events.description: FBI coordinates transfer of evidence (Epstein's clothing) to the medical examiner and plans interviews with those who discovered Epstein's body.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 12, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his jail cell.
The NYC Medical Examiner's Office requested to examine the clothing Epstein was wearing when found.
The FBI was coordinating interviews with individuals who discovered Epstein's body.
Evidence was being physically transported from the FBI to the Medical Examiner's Office.
The communication shows immediate investigative coordination between federal and city agencies following Epstein's death.
